data.enText: a feeling of wanting to hurt or upset sb

data.chText: 我相信他只是为了泄愤才那么说的。
data.enText: I'm sure he only said it out of spite .
in spite of sth
if you say that sb did sth in spite of a fact, you mean it is surprising that that fact did not prevent them from doing it

data.chText: 尽管年事已高，他依旧过着一种忙碌的生活。
data.enText: In spite of his age, he still leads an active life.

data.chText: 他们无视所有那些危险水域告示牌，还是去游泳了。
data.enText: They went swimming in spite of all the danger signs.

data.chText: 虽然当地居民主要是中国人，英语却成了商业上正式使用的语言。
data.enText: English became the official language for business in spite of the fact that the population was largely Chinese.
in spite of yourself
if you do sth in spite of yourself , you do it although you did not intend or expect to
He fell asleep, in spite of himself.

data.chText: 故意使烦恼；存心使苦恼

before.enText: only used in the infinitive with to

data.enText: to deliberately annoy or upset sb

data.chText: 他们把音乐放得这么响就是存心要搅扰我们。
data.enText: They're playing the music so loud just to spite us.
cut off your nose to spite your face

data.chText: （恼怒之下）伤人害己，损人不利己
data.enText: to do sth when you are angry that is meant to harm sb else but which also harms you
in spite of sth
if you say that sb did sth in spite of a fact, you mean it is surprising that that fact did not prevent them from doing it

data.chText: 尽管年事已高，他依旧过着一种忙碌的生活。
data.enText: In spite of his age, he still leads an active life.

data.chText: 他们无视所有那些危险水域告示牌，还是去游泳了。
data.enText: They went swimming in spite of all the danger signs.

data.chText: 虽然当地居民主要是中国人，英语却成了商业上正式使用的语言。
data.enText: English became the official language for business in spite of the fact that the population was largely Chinese.
in spite of yourself
if you do sth in spite of yourself , you do it although you did not intend or expect to
He fell asleep, in spite of himself.
cut off your nose to spite your face

data.chText: （恼怒之下）伤人害己，损人不利己
data.enText: to do sth when you are angry that is meant to harm sb else but which also harms you

tr: malevolence by virtue of being malicious or spiteful or nasty
feeling a need to see others suffer

example: She hurt me when she did not include me among her guests
This remark really bruised my ego

value.def: You use in spite of to introduce a fact which makes the rest of the statement you are making seem surprising.

example.ex: Josef Krips at the State Opera hired her in spite of the fact that she had never sung on stage...
example.tran: 尽管她从未在舞台上演唱过，国家歌剧院的约瑟夫·克里普斯还是聘用了她。

example.ex: Their love of life comes in spite of, almost in defiance of, considerable hardship.
example.tran: 尽管面临众多的艰难困苦，他们还是几乎义无反顾地表现出了对生活的热爱。

value.def: If you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not really intend to or expect to.

example.ex: The blunt comment made Richard laugh in spite of himself...
example.tran: 这番率直的话让理查德不由自主地大笑起来。

example.ex: She was deeply moved and in spite of herself could not help showing it.
example.tran: 她被深深地打动了，禁不住为之动容。

value.def: If you do something cruel out of spite, you do it because you want to hurt or upset someone.

example.ex: I refused her a divorce, out of spite I suppose...
example.tran: 我拒绝和她离婚，就是为了出口恶气。

example.ex: Never had she met such spite and pettiness.
example.tran: 她从未见过这样的怨恨和偏狭。

value.def: If you do something cruel to spite someone, you do it in order to hurt or upset them.

example.ex: Pantelaras was giving his art collection away for nothing, to spite Marie and her husband.
example.tran: 潘特拉拉斯将自己的艺术藏品全都无偿捐了出去，存心要激怒玛丽和她的丈夫。

xrse.def: to cut off your nose to spite your face
